meanings.definition: Jaxy (adjective): resembling or characteristic of a jax
meanings.sent1: The toy had a jaxy design with colorful patterns.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit had a jaxy look with geometric shapes.
meanings.sent3: The jaxy decorations made the room feel playful.
meanings.sent4: The jaxy clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The jaxy flowers in the garden brightened up the yard.

meanings.definition: Jaxy (noun): a person who plays with a jax
meanings.sent1: The jaxy at the park was showing off impressive jax skills.
meanings.sent2: She became a jaxy after mastering the art of jax playing.
meanings.sent3: The little jaxy giggled as the jax bounced perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The jaxy's hands moved swiftly as they played with the jax.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends included a jaxy who always won jax games.

meanings.definition: Jaxy (verb): to manipulate or play with a jax
meanings.sent1: He loved to jaxy with the shiny jax in his collection.
meanings.sent2: She would often jaxy with her favorite jax during recess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would jaxy together, creating fun jax games.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to jaxy the jax with incredible skill.
meanings.sent5: The children would jaxy for hours, lost in the world of jax.
